name: Ashfall
description:
Heavy white clouds of swirling smoke fill the sky, and it rains ash that coats everything in little flecks. A smell of burning wood or sulphur permeates the air.

The sky is blocked. High flying aerial creatures have total cover, and outdoor light does not count as sunlight (for the purposes of sunlight sensitivity and similar traits). Checks using Navigation Tools to determine your location based on celestial observation are made with disadvantage.

name: Blizzard
description:
At the end of every hour spend in a Blizzard, make a DC 12 Constitution saving. On failure, you take [[/r 3d4 #cold damage]] cold damage and gain one level of exhaustion. You make this check with advantage if you have proper gear.

All creatures are heavily obscured if they are more than 20 feet from you. All terrain is difficult terrain.

Unpleasant to travel in. All travel speed is halved. If snow occurs for two days in row, all terrain is difficult terrain and wagon travel is impossible until one day without snow passes.

The sky is blocked. High flying aerial creatures have total cover, and outdoor light does not count as sunlight (for the purposes of sunlight sensitivity and similar traits).

Checks using Navigation Tools to determine your location based on celestial observation are made with disadvantage.

If you attempt to take a long rest without cover and heat, you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw gain the benefits for a long rest. If you fail by 5 or more, you gain an additional level of Exhaustion.

Turbulent gusts sweep across the land.
Select a wind direction based on locale or roll a [[/r 1d4 #Wind Direction: 1 - North, 2 - East, 3 - South, 4 - West]].

Flying creatures gain +10 movement speed when moving with the wind, and –10 movement speed when moving against it. All ranged weapon attacks have a –2 to attack rolls, and their range is reduced by half when shooting into the wind.

Because the rain freezes when it reaches the ground, creating a thin layer of slippery ice, all outdoor terrain is difficult terrain.

description: Blistering heat that is unpleasant to travel in.
